questions.text: Fluoroacetate is a component of pesticides. Which of the following metabolic pathways is inhibited by this compound?
The conversion of pyruvate to acetyl coenzyme A and carbon dioxide:

options.label: A
options.text: Involves the participation of lipoic acid.

options.label: B
options.text: Is activated when pyruvate decarboxylase of the pyruvate dehydrogenase complex (PDHC) is phosphorylated by PDH kinase in the presence of ATP.

questions.correct_answer: A. Involves the participation of lipoic acid.
questions.explanation: Ans.  A) Involves the participation of lipoic acid.

questions.text: Thiamine deficiency decreases energy generation because of?

options.label: A
options.text: Decrease activity of alpha ketoglutarate and pyruvate dehydrogenase

options.label: B
options.text: It is cofactor in oxidative reduction

questions.correct_answer: A. Decrease activity of alpha ketoglutarate and pyruvate dehydrogenase
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Decrease activity of alpha ketoglutarate and pyruvate dehydrogenase

questions.text: Which reaction in the diagram below would be inhibited in the presence of large amounts of avidin, an egg white protein that binds and sequesters biotin?
Pyruvate can be converted directly to all of the following except:

A 25-year-old female presents with recurrent episodes of fasting hypoglycemia and mild hepatomegaly. She reports that her symptoms improve significantly after consuming carbohydrates. Laboratory investigations reveal elevated levels of glycogen in her liver, and enzyme analysis confirms a deficiency in liver phosphorylase kinase activity. The physician explains that this condition affects glycogen breakdown. Which of the following enzymes is directly responsible for catalyzing the breakdown of glycogen into glucose-1-phosphate?

A newborn is found to have fasting hypoglycemia. The nursery staff begins overnight feeds by nasogastric tube because they find that the child has consistently low blood sugars. A liver biopsy and molecular studies demonstrate an absence of glycogen synthase. The normal function of this enzyme is to do which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Remove glucose residues one at a time from glycogen in the liver

options.label: B
options.text: Remove glucose residues one at a time from glycogen in muscles

options.label: C
options.text: Transfer glucose from UDP-glucose to the nonreducing end of a glycogen primer

questions.correct_answer: C. Transfer glucose from UDP-glucose to the nonreducing end of a glycogen primer
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Transfer glucose from UDP-glucose to the nonreducing end of a glycogen primer

questions.text: Child is presented with hypoglycemia, hepatomegaly and accumulation of branched glycogen called limit dextrin. Most probable diagnosis is.

A 50-year-old patient with a recent diagnosis of lung cancer is undergoing metabolic testing to better understand the biochemical environment of their tumor. The oncologist is specifically interested in the altered metabolic pathways commonly associated with cancer cells. During evaluation, it is found that the cancer cells in the patient's tumor are primarily using glucose to produce lactate even in the presence of oxygen. The oncologist suspects that this alteration in metabolism is influencing the growth and survival of the tumor. Which of the following statements about this altered metabolic pathway is most accurate?

options.label: B
options.text: It is a form of aerobic glycolysis with lactate formation

options.label: C
options.text: It results in the production of more ATP compared to normal cellular respiration

options.label: D
options.text: It leads to decreased glucose uptake by the cancer cells

questions.correct_answer: B. It is a form of aerobic glycolysis with lactate formation
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It is a form of aerobic glycolysis with lactate formation

Aldolase B : Patient of aldolae b deficiency was seen in the OPD. Feeding of fructose will cause hypoglycemia in the patient. Reason : Fructose 1 phosphate inhibits liver phosphorylase.

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both correct but R is not explanation of A

questions.correct_answer: A. A and R both correct and R is explanation of A
questions.explanation: Ans. A) A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

questions.text: ADP to ATP conversion in mitochondria is affected by
Which of the following is false about electron transport chain?

options.label: A
options.text: There is no production of ATP at complex 2 as it does not translocate H ion from mit. Matrix to intermembranous space

options.label: B
options.text: Complex 1, translocate 4 H ion from mit. Matrix to intermembranous space

options.label: C
options.text: Complex 3, translocate 3 H ion from mit. Matrix to intermembranous space

questions.correct_answer: C. Complex 3, translocate 3 H ion from mit. Matrix to intermembranous space
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Complex 3, translocate 3 H ion from mit. Matrix to intermembranous space

questions.text: Under conditions of anaerobic glycolysis, the NAD+ required by glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase is supplied by a reaction catalyzed by which of the following enzymes?
Which of the following enzymes is common for both glycogenolysis and gluconeogenesis?
A child presents with hepatomegaly and bilateral lenticular opacities. Deficiency of which of the following enzymes will not cause such features.
Acetyl CoA plays a central role in energy metabolism, acting as a substrate for several biosynthetic pathways. Which of the following is NOT a product of Acetyl CoA conversion?

A biochemistry professor discusses the structural differences between various monosaccharides. D-Glucose and D-Galactose are classified as epimers because they differ in the arrangement of the hydroxyl group around a single carbon atom. Which carbon atom is responsible for their epimeric relationship?

A 3-year-old girl is brought to the clinic with a notably protruding abdomen, an umbilical hernia, coarse facial features, corneal clouding, intellectual disability, and short stature. Based on these clinical features, what is the most likely diagnosis?

A 40-year-old male is diagnosed with mucopolysaccharidosis and exhibits proteinuria, suggesting impaired filtration in the renal glomerulus. The condition is associated with the accumulation of glycosaminoglycans (GAGs), one of which plays a key role in maintaining the charge selectiveness of the glomerular basement membrane. Which GAG is most likely accumulating in this patient and is responsible for this function?

A 35-year-old male consumes a meal high in carbohydrates and experiences normal metabolic adjustments. In the fed state, glucose uptake by the liver increases due to insulin signaling, and glucose-6-phosphate plays a central role in metabolic pathways. Which of the following is the most likely primary fate of glucose-6-phosphate in the liver during the fed state?

options.label: A
options.text: Conversion to lactate via anaerobic glycolysis

options.label: C
options.text: Oxidation in the mitochondria via β-oxidation

questions.text: A previously normal 2-month-old Caucasian girl is evaluated because of jittery spells (trembling, irritability) several hours after meals. A low blood glucose value is noted, and physical examination demonstrates a liver edge some two finger-breadths below the right costal margin. Percussion of the right chest and abdomen confirms that the liver width is slightly enlarged. Hospital testing reveals that the infant can increase her blood glucose after breast-feeding but that it is not maintained at normal levels 3 to 4 hours after feeding. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Galactosemia with inability to convert lactose to glucose

options.label: C
options.text: Fructosemia with inability to liberate sucrose from glucose

questions.text: Liver enzyme dephosphorylation to phosphorylation true is-

options.label: C
options.text: More commonly seen in fed state than in fasting state

options.label: D
options.text: Always activated by cAMP dependent tyrosine kinase

questions.text: 2,4-Dinitrophenol (DNP), an uncoupler of oxidative phosphorylation, was used as a weight-loss agent in the 1930s. Reports of fatal overdoses led to its discontinuation in 1939. Which of the following would most likely be true concerning individuals taking 2,4-DNP?

options.label: A
options.text: ATP levels in the mitochondria are greater than normal.

options.label: B
options.text: Body temperature is elevated as a result of hypermetabolism.

options.label: C
options.text: The proton gradient across the inner mitochondrial membrane is greater than normal.

options.label: D
options.text: The rate of electron transport is abnormally low.

questions.correct_answer: B. Body temperature is elevated as a result of hypermetabolism.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Body temperature is elevated as a result of hypermetabolism.

questions.text: Patients with diabetes frequently report changing visual acuities when their glucose levels are chronically high. Which of the following could explain the fluctuating acuity with high blood glucose levels?

options.label: C
options.text: Increased oxidative phosphorylation in the lens

questions.correct_answer: A. Increased sorbitol in the lens
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Increased sorbitol in the lens

questions.text: Which one of following statements about glycolysis and gluconeogenesis is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: All the reactions of glycolysis are freely reversible for gluconeogenesis.

options.label: B
options.text: Glycolysis can proceed in the absence of oxygen only if pyruvate is formed from lactate in muscle.

options.label: C
options.text: Red blood cells only metabolize glucose by anaerobic glycolysis (and the pentose phosphate pathway).

options.label: D
options.text: The reverse of glycolysis is the pathway for gluconeogenesis in skeletal muscle.

questions.correct_answer: C. Red blood cells only metabolize glucose by anaerobic glycolysis (and the pentose phosphate pathway).
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Red blood cells only metabolize glucose by anaerobic glycolysis (and the pentose phosphate pathway).

questions.text: A blood sample is taken from a 50-year-old woman after an overnight fast. Which one of the following will be at a higher concentration than after she had eaten a meal?

An adolescent female develops hemiballismus after anesthesia for a routine operation. She is tall and lanky, and it is noted that she and her sister both had previous operations for dislocated lenses of the eyes. The symptoms are suspicious for the disease homocystinuria. Which of the following statements is descriptive of this disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Patients may be treated with dietary supplements of vitamin B12

options.label: B
options.text: Patients may be treated with dietary supplements of vitamin C

options.label: C
options.text: There is deficient excretion of homocysteine

options.label: D
options.text: There is a defect in the ability to form cystathionine from homocysteine and serine

questions.correct_answer: D. There is a defect in the ability to form cystathionine from homocysteine and serine
questions.explanation: Ans. D) There is a defect in the ability to form cystathionine from homocysteine and serine

questions.text: A particular point mutation results in disruption of the α-helical structure in a segment of the mutant protein. The most likely change in the primary structure of the mutant protein is:

Which of the following enzyme can use both NAD and NADP

A 9-month-old infant, is brought to the pediatric clinic by her concerned parents with history of generalized fits. Baby had delayed milestone and was lethargic, hair was grey colored and skin was light colored. Mother gave the history of mousy odor in the urine. On IQ assessment patient has intellectual disability. In one of the following rare variants of PKU The enzyme deficient is?
An individual harboring a mutation in ornithine transcarbamoylase (OTC) would be expected to exhibit which of the following measurable abnormalities?

options.label: B
options.text: Elevated urinary excretion of argininosuccinic acid

questions.correct_answer: C. Elevation in blood orotic acid
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Elevation in blood orotic acid

questions.text: In Hyper Ammonia Type I there is increase ammonia due to deficiency of CPS-I, ammonia is toxic to brain by decreasing the following substrate of TCA cycle:

Child presents with hypotonia and seizures. It was confirmed to be Zellweger syndrome. Which among the following accumulates in brain in this condition?
questions.correct_answer: C. Very long chain fatty acid
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Very long chain fatty acid

questions.text: Lipoprotien lipase [LPL] is the endothelial cell associated enzyme necessary for release of fatty acids from circulating lipoproteins. Which of the following apolipoproteins is required to activate LPL mediated release of fatty acids from chylomicrons?

A 15-year-old boy has been diagnosed with retinitis pigmentosa, peripheral polyneuropathy, and cerebellar ataxia. Analysis of his cerebrospinal fluid indicated a high protein content but no elevation of cell number. A telling clinical finding was a high level of serum phytanic acid. These findings are indicative of which of the following disorders?
Hormone sensitive lipase is not activated by?

Ketogenesis is biochemical reaction in which ketone bodies are synthesized in the liver through the degradation of free fatty acids and ketogenic amino acids. Which statement about ketogenesis is false?

options.label: A
options.text: Ketone bodies are utilized by hepatocytes

options.label: B
options.text: Ketogenesis occurs in the mitochondria of hepatocytes

options.label: C
options.text: Ketosis can deplete the alkali reserve

options.label: D
options.text: Ketogenesis is exaggerated in diabetes mellitus and prolonged starvation. It is termed as Ketosis

questions.correct_answer: A. Ketone bodies are utilized by hepatocytes
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Ketone bodies are utilized by hepatocytes

questions.text: Presence of ketonuria and absence of glycosuria are the essential clinical manifestations in one of the following conditions?
Which of the following enzyme is not a component of fatty acid synthase complex?
Which of the following are products of triacylglycerol breakdown and subsequent β-oxidation that may undergo gluconeogenesis?
Which one of the following acts as lung surfactant?
In comparative sizes of Lipoproteins, ‘A’ represents:

Which one of the following is the major product of fatty acid synthase complex ?
Malonyl-CoA, the first intermediate in fatty acid synthesis, is an important reciprocal regulator of fatty acid metabolism BECAUSE:

options.label: A
options.text: Its formation from acetyl-CoA and bicarbonate by the enzyme acetyl-CoA carboxylase is the main rate-limiting step in fatty acid synthesis.

options.label: B
options.text: It prevents entry of fatty acyl groups into the matrix of the mitochondria because it is a potent inhibitor of carnitine palmitoyl transferase-1.

options.label: C
options.text: It prevents entry of fatty acyl groups into the matrix of the mitochondria because it is a potent inhibitor of carnitine palmitoyl transferase-II.

options.label: D
options.text: It prevents entry of fatty acyl groups into the matrix of the mitochondria because it is a potent inhibitor of carnitine- acylcarnitine translocase.

questions.correct_answer: B. It prevents entry of fatty acyl groups into the matrix of the mitochondria because it is a potent inhibitor of carnitine palmitoyl transferase-1.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It prevents entry of fatty acyl groups into the matrix of the mitochondria because it is a potent inhibitor of carnitine palmitoyl transferase-1.

questions.text: Niemann-Pick disease, like other neurolipidoses, present in infancy or childhood with plateauing of development and neurologic regression. The accumulating substance (with foamy appearance) is a phospholipid made in which of the following steps in the figure below?
The backbone of a DNA molecule as shown in image, consists of which of the following?
questions.correct_answer: D. Alternating phosphate and sugar groups
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Alternating phosphate and sugar groups

questions.text: Restriction enzymes are used to cleave genomic DNA into smaller fragments. Which of the following single-strand DNA sequences has the best potential to be a site of action for a restriction endonuclease?
The rate of DNA synthesis in a culture of cells could be most accurately determined by measuring the incorporation of which of the following radioactive compounds?
The base sequence of the strand of DNA used as the template for transcription has the base sequence GATCTAC. What is the base sequence of RNA product?

The production of mRNA in eukaryotic cells requires a large number of steps, and drugs targeted to any of these steps could block mRNA production. Which one of the following accurately describes a part of the process of producing mRNA from a eukaryotic gene?

options.label: A
options.text: The coding strand of DNA is the strand used by RNA polymerase during transcription.

options.label: B
options.text: The template DNA strand is identical to the RNA transcript except that the DNA strand contains thymine and the RNA strand contains uracil.

options.label: C
options.text: The first RNA form produced contains both intron and exon sequences.

options.label: D
options.text: Mature mRNA contains a cap at the 5′-end, a poly (A) tail at the 3′ end, introns, and exons.

questions.correct_answer: C. The first RNA form produced contains both intron and exon sequences.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The first RNA form produced contains both intron and exon sequences

questions.text: All of the following are true about DNA polymerase except:

options.label: B
options.text: Beta polymerase has no proof reading

options.label: C
options.text: DNA G protein has primase activity in E. Coli

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. DNA polymerase two has no proof reading
questions.explanation: Ans. D) DNA polymerase two has no proof reading

questions.text: Most aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases possess an activity that is shared with DNA polymerases. This activity is a _________ function.

If a tRNA has anticodon sequence 5'-GCU-3′, what codon would it recognize?

A 32-year-old male presents with symptoms of muscle weakness, difficulty swallowing, and progressive fatigue. After a thorough evaluation, it is determined that the patient has a genetic disorder causing a deficiency in an enzyme that plays a critical role in protein synthesis. This enzyme is responsible for catalyzing the formation of peptide bonds between amino acids during translation. Which of the following enzymes is most likely deficient in this patient, and what is its primary chemical composition?
Excessive ultraviolet (uv) radiation is harmful to life. The damage caused to the biological systems by ultraviolet radiation is by
In the given image, a child develops blisters on exposure to sunlight. Irregular dark spots on the skin are also found. Which of the following DNA repair mechanisms is defective?

A scientist is investigating Chronic Myeloid Leukemia (CML). He develops a fluorescent DNA probe to bind to BCR-ABL fusion gene for visualization of Philadelphia translocation. Which molecular technique is he using?
Rapid method of chromosome identification in interphase is
True about Sickle cell disease are all, Except:

options.label: A
options.text: Single nucleotide change results in change of Glutamine to Valine

options.label: B
options.text: Sticky patch is generated as a result of replacement of a non polar residue with a polar residue

options.label: C
options.text: HbS confers resistance against malaria in heterozygotes

options.label: D
options.text: RFLP results from a single base change

questions.correct_answer: B. Sticky patch is generated as a result of replacement of a non polar residue with a polar residue
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Sticky patch is generated as a result of replacement of a non polar residue with a polar residue

options.label: A
options.text: Amino acid activation by attachment to a tRNA

options.text: Correct alignment of the mRNA on the 40S ribosome

In an enzyme kinetics experiment, the substrate concentration is maintained at a level significantly higher than the Km​, effectively saturating the enzyme. Under these conditions, 1% of the substrate is converted into 20 µmol of product in 10 minutes using a fixed amount of enzyme. In a second experiment, half the enzyme amount is used, but the substrate concentration increased to Double of previous experiment. How long would it take to produce the same amount (20 µmol) of product in this modified experiment?

An enzyme kinetics experiment is conducted to study the interaction between an enzyme and its substrate. It is observed that when the substrate concentration reaches 5 µm, the reaction achieves half of its maximum velocity. Which of the following accurately describes the Michaelis constant (Km​)?

options.label: A
options.text: The substrate concentration at which the enzyme operates at maximum velocity

options.label: B
options.text: The substrate concentration at half of the enzyme's maximum velocity

options.label: C
options.text: An irrelevant parameter that does not describe enzyme behavior

options.label: D
options.text: A high Km value indicates strong substrate affinity by the enzyme

questions.correct_answer: B. The substrate concentration at half of the enzyme's maximum velocity

questions.text: Which of the following enzymes is known to have Zinc as a cofactor?

A 55-year-old male with hypercholesterolemia is prescribed a statin medication to lower his LDL cholesterol levels. Statins act as competitive inhibitors of HMG-CoA reductase, the rate-limiting enzyme in cholesterol biosynthesis. Which of the following correctly describes the effect of competitive inhibition on enzyme kinetics?

options.label: A
options.text: Competitive inhibitors decrease Km and increase Vmax.

options.label: B
options.text: Competitive inhibitors increase Km and decrease Vmax.

options.label: C
options.text: Competitive inhibitors increase Km but do not alter Vmax.

options.label: D
options.text: Competitive inhibitors have no effect on Km or Vmax.

questions.correct_answer: C. Competitive inhibitors increase Km but do not alter Vmax.

questions.text: A research study examines the effect of an inhibitor on the enzyme kinetics of a metabolic reaction. The Lineweaver-Burk plot of the reaction is analyzed, showing two lines: one for the enzyme activity without the inhibitor and the other with the inhibitor. Based on this information, what type of enzyme inhibition is being represented in this plot?
Gibbs free energy curve of an enzyme-catalyzed reaction is given by
A baby presented with convulsions due vitamin to B6 deficiency. A test to identify vitamin B6 deficiency is:
Which of the following plays a role in the hydroxylation of proline and lysine in collagen synthesis?
In folate deficiency the False statement is?

options.label: A
options.text: High homocysteine and normal methylmalonic acid

options.label: C
options.text: Vitamin B12 supplementation is recommended along with Folate

options.label: D
options.text: Purine and pyrimidine synthesis are affected

questions.correct_answer: B. Hemolytic anemia is a feature
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Hemolytic anemia is a feature

questions.text: A 65-year-old patient with a history of deep vein thrombosis is being treated with warfarin. The patient is monitored regularly for changes in coagulation factors, and the doctor is aware that warfarin inhibits the synthesis of certain clotting factors. On which of the following coagulation factors does warfarin treatment decrease γ-carboxyglutamate residues, impairing its function?

A 15-month-old female child whose growth rate has been in the low over the last year presents with chronic, nonproductive cough for which she was prescribed antibiotics and taking for long time patient has diarrhea with foul-smelling stools. She is diagnosed as having cystic fibrosis. For which of the following vitamins is this child most likely to be at risk of deficiency?
Keshan disease is disease caused by deficiency of?

A 35-year-old patient is brought to the emergency department after accidentally ingesting a large amount of industrial alcohol, thinking it was an alcoholic beverage. The patient is presenting with symptoms of metabolic acidosis, visual disturbances, and altered mental status. The physician suspects methanol poisoning. Which of the following metabolic byproducts is most commonly associated with methanol poisoning?

A 30-year-old male with a history of strenuous physical exercise arrives at the emergency department presenting with confusion, tremors, and dizziness. He reports that he forgot to eat after his workout and later consumed a significant amount of alcohol at a party. His blood glucose levels are found to be low, and the physician suspects that his metabolic processes have been disrupted by alcohol consumption. Which of the following metabolic pathways is most likely inhibited by alcohol in this patient?

A patient presented with dermatitis and loss of appetite. He also gives a frequent history of diarrhoea. On examination, alopecia also seen and patient has observed that he has delayed wound healing. This patient is most likely to have deficiency of:
After alcohol ingestion, which of the following intermediates accumulates in liver that is not typical of glycolysis or the citric acid cycle ?
This unique absorption pattern is shown by which analyte?

A girl with habit of eating paint peeled off from the wall presented with complaints of acute abdominal pain on and off with tingling sensation of limbs associated with weakness of the limbs. Which of the enzyme will show reduced activity in this patient?

There is a single enzyme-catalyzed reaction in the human body known to generate carbon monoxide (CO) as one of its products. Which of the following enzymes represents the one that catalyzes this CO-producing reaction?

30-year-old man presented at clinic with a history of intermittent abdominal pain and episodes of confusion and psychiatric problems. Laboratory tests revealed increases of urinary δ-aminolevulinate and porphobilinogen. Mutational analysis revealed a mutation in the gene for uroporphyrinogen I synthase (porphobilinogen deaminase). The probable diagnosis was:

Assertion (A): Homocysteine is remethylated to methionine in a reaction that requires vitamin B12 and folate as cofactors. Reason (R): The enzyme responsible for this reaction, methionine synthase, utilizes methylcobalamin as a coenzyme, which receives a methyl group from 5-methyl-tetrahydrofolate (methyl-THF).

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both are correct, but R is not the correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A is incorrect, but R is a correct statement

options.label: C
options.text: A and R both are correct, and R is the correct explanation of A

options.label: D
options.text: A and R both are incorrect

questions.correct_answer: C. A and R both are correct, and R is the correct explanation of A
